Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of man. Head only, with nose missing. Mould-made. Dark red-brown Nile silt fabric with black core. Abundant fine gold mica, quartz, organics and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Head of a grotesque figure with pre-firing damage, suggesting that this was made locally. A late 2nd century BC parallel is published by Fischer that has lower Egypt and Memphis parallels (Fischer 1994, 445) . However a piece from Memphis is also similar, so an earlier date cannot be ruled out (Petrie 1910, pl.45, no.173). Fischer, J. 1994. Griechisch-römische Terrakotten aus Ägypten. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber. Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen. Tübingen, Wasmuth. Petrie, W.M.Fl. MacKay, E. and Wainwright, G. 1910, Meydum and Memphis III. London.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.559) (Phase 1)
